title: Automated Natural Language Explanation of Deep Visual Neurons with Large Models. (arXiv:2310.10708v1 [cs.CV])
abstract: Deep neural networks have exhibited remarkable performance across a wide range of real-world tasks. However, comprehending the underlying reasons for their effectiveness remains a challenging problem. Interpreting deep neural networks through examining neurons offers distinct advantages when it comes to exploring the inner workings of neural networks. Previous research has indicated that specific neurons within deep vision networks possess semantic meaning and play pivotal roles in model performance. Nonetheless, the current methods for generating neuron semantics heavily rely on human intervention, which hampers their scalability and applicability. To address this limitation, this paper proposes a novel post-hoc framework for generating semantic explanations of neurons with large foundation models, without requiring human intervention or prior knowledge. Our framework is designed to be compatible with various model architectures and datasets, facilitating automated and scalable neuron

translated_title: 带有大型模型的深度视觉神经元的自动自然语言解释
translated_abstract: 深度神经网络在各种实际任务中展现出了卓越的性能。然而，理解其有效性的根本原因仍然是一个具有挑战性的问题。通过检查神经元来解释深度神经网络在探索神经网络的内部机制方面具有独特的优势。先前的研究表明，深度视觉网络中的特定神经元具有语义含义，并在模型性能中起到关键作用。然而，当前生成神经元语义的方法严重依赖于人为干预，这限制了其可扩展性和适用性。为了解决这个限制，本文提出了一个新的事后框架，用于生成大型基础模型的神经元的语义解释，而不需要人为干预或先前知识。我们的框架被设计为与各种模型架构和数据集兼容，便于自动化和可扩展的神经元解释生成。
tldr: 这篇论文提出了一个适用于大型模型的自动化神经元解释框架，该框架不需要人为干预或先前知识，并且具有可扩展性和适用性。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes an automated framework for explaining neurons in large models, which does not require human intervention or prior knowledge, and is scalable and applicable.
